hypothesis_content.title: Fed Liquidity vs. Crypto Exchange Reserves Timing
hypothesis_content.statement: Increases in aggregate stablecoin exchange reserves lead BTC price rallies by 12-36 hours following Fed liquidity injections. Buying when reserves increase >5% in 24 hours and selling 36 hours later yields positive expectancy during NEUTRAL/BULL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Fed liquidity flows first into stablecoins (shadow banking), then into exchange reserves, then into crypto assets. This creates a measurable chain with consistent timing. The recent QT end provides a clean test case.
entry_conditions: Aggregate stablecoin exchange reserves (USDT+USDC+DAI) increase >5% in 24h
Increase occurs within 2 days of identified Fed liquidity operation
BTC price has not yet moved >3% in same period
Regime confidence for NEUTRAL or BULL > 60%

exit_conditions.take_profit: 36 hours after entry, regardless of price
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price drops >4% below entry before 36h exit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If stablecoin reserve increases fail to predict BTC moves within 36-hour window over 3 consecutive instances, breaking the causal chain.
